snippet: Florida’s election chief told the Justice Department on Wednesday that the state would continue to search for ineligible voters despite federal objections.
abstract: Ken Detzner, Florida's secretary of state, tells the Justice Department that the state will continue to scrub its election rolls of voters who are not American citizens, despite federal objections; state has been criticized for relying on a database with outdated information to pinpoint potentially ineligible voters.
lead_paragraph: Florida’s election chief told the Justice Department on Wednesday that the state would continue to search for ineligible voters despite federal objections.

headline.seo: Florida Vows to Continue Its Search for Ineligible Voters
headline.main: Florida Defends Search for Ineligible Voters
headline.print_headline: Florida Defends Search for Ineligible Voters
